sentences: Ja elurõõm hakkas temas morni tõsidust nurka suruma.
Surub vastase raudse loogika ning argumentidega nurka.
context: The word 'nurka' is the partitive singular and illative singular form of the Estonian noun 'nurk'. As a partitive, it can mean 'of corner' or some corner, while as an illative it means 'into corner' or 'to a corner'. It refers to a physical corner of a room or space, or an angle in geometry. The word is commonly used when talking about movement toward corners or positioning things in corners.
